title: Bill Fielding
text:
William Fielding (17 June 1915 – May 2006) was an English <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> for <a href="Cardiff%20City%20F.C.">Cardiff City</a>, <a href="Bolton%20Wanderers%20F.C.">Bolton Wanderers</a> and <a href="Manchester%20United%20F.C.">Manchester United</a> in the 1930s and 1940s.
Career.
Born in <a href="Congleton">Broadhurst, Congleton</a>, <a href="Cheshire">Cheshire</a>, Fielding began his football career playing for the Broadbottom YMCA's team, before joining <a href="Ashton%20United%20F.C.">Hurst</a>. In May 1936, at the age of 20, Fielding joined <a href="Cardiff%20City%20F.C.">Cardiff City</a>, where he played until the outbreak of the <a href="World%20War%20II">Second World War</a> in 1939, making a total of 50 appearances in that time. During the war, Fielding made guest appearances for <a href="Stockport%20County%20F.C.">Stockport County</a> and <a href="Bolton%20Wanderers%20F.C.">Bolton Wanderers</a>. He officially became a Bolton Wanderers player in June 1944, but never made a league appearance for them.
In January 1947, Fielding signed for <a href="Manchester%20United%20F.C.">Manchester United</a> as cover for the injured <a href="Jack%20Crompton">Jack Crompton</a> in a deal which saw <a href="Billy%20Wrigglesworth">Billy Wrigglesworth</a> move to Bolton. He made his debut on 25 January 1947, playing in the club's <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> Fourth Round defeat to <a href="Nottingham%20Forest%20F.C.">Nottingham Forest</a>. He played in seven consecutive games for United, culminating with a 4–3 away defeat to <a href="Derby%20County%20F.C.">Derby County</a> on 15 March. However, he never played for the club again after that, and retired from football in 1948.
